title: 106_hr2410
content: The Act is titled the "Drug-Free School Zone Enforcement Act" and reserves funds for enforcement. The Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act of 1994 is amended to reserve a minimum of $150,000,000 for grants under subpart 2 each fiscal year starting from 2000. Subparts 2 and 3 are redesignated as subparts 3 and 4, with corresponding amendments to sections within the Act. The Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act of 1994 is amended to redesignate sections 7131 and 7133 as sections 4131 and 4132. Funding under the Act is also amended by changing section 4004(2) to section 7104(3). SEC. 3. GRANTS TO REDUCE DRUG USE AND TRANSACTIONS IN SCHOOL ZONES. The Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act of 1994 is amended to include a new section on Drug-Free School Zone Enforcement, specifically addressing state allotments. The Secretary shall allot funds among states for section 4122 based on population and previous funding received, with a minimum allotment set. The Secretary may reallot funds as needed. The Secretary can reallot any unutilized funds to a State within two years of allotment, following the same basis as initial allotments. State grants are available for drug-free school zone enforcement under SEC. 4122. State agencies must submit an application to the Secretary to receive funding under section 4121, containing assurances and required information. The funds must be used to make subgrants to local government units, with a minimum of 95 percent allotted for this purpose. Local government units receiving subgrants must use funds to reduce drug-related activities near schools by hiring law enforcement officers, prosecutors, and coordinating with drug enforcement agencies. State and Federal drug enforcement agencies are allotted funds under section 4121, with a limit of 5 percent for administrative costs incurred by the State agency. In section 4123, definitions for "State" and "unit of local government" are provided.
